title: Queenstown charged after leading police on two hour car chase
text:
A Queenstown man has been charged with a string of driving offences after allegely leading police on a near two hour chase through the city and suburbs on Friday night.

The driver first caught the attention of police when he allegedly drove through a red light on North Terrace just after midnight.



Police lost sight of his blue Mitsubishi sedan and opted not to pursue him.

Instead, cordons were set up and the police helictoper was called in to help locate the driver.

The car was spotted again at 12.30am in Brompton.

The police helicopter tracked the car through various suburbs until 2.20am when tyre spikes were used to slow the vehicle on Regency Rd at Dudley Park.

The car came to a stop in nearby Stacy Crt where the driver, a 32-year-old man from Queenstown, was arrested.

He was charged with driving dangerous to evade police, driving in a dangerous manner, resisting arrest and breaching bail.

He was refused bail and will appear in court on Monday.
description: A Queenstown man will face court over a string of driving offences after he allegedly led police on a two hour chase through the city and suburbs on Friday night.
